security_center.checks.a_records_proxied: A DNS 'A' Record is not proxied by Cloudflare. This origin server is directly exposed and has a higher risk of a DDoS attack. |||| %{smart_count} DNS 'A' Records are not proxied by Cloudflare. These origin servers are directly exposed and have a higher risk of a DDoS attack.
DNS 'A' record not proxied by Cloudflare
This DNS record is not proxied by Cloudflare. Your origin server is directly exposed and has a higher risk of a DDoS attack.
An attacker can bypass Cloudflare by targeting the origin IP address directly with a DDoS attack.
We reviewed your Cloudflare DNS settings and checked whether your hostname accepts connections on either port 80 or 443.
Configure Cloudflare to proxy the DNS record

By setting up Cloudflare as your hostname's reverse proxy, Cloudflare protects origin servers from DDoS attacks by hiding their IP addresses. You can configure Cloudflare to proxy your hostname in your DNS settings.

security_center.checks.dangling_a_record: A DNS 'A' Record is pointing to an IP address you may no longer control. You have a higher risk of subdomain takeover. |||| %{smart_count} DNS 'A' Records are pointing to IP addresses you may no longer control. You have a higher risk of subdomain takeover.

security_center.checks.tls_encryption.ge: We detect a domain without TLS encryption. Any data transmitted to or from your domain may be visible to others. |||| We detect %{smart_count} domains without TLS encryption. Any data transmitted to or from your domain may be visible to others.
security_center.checks.tls_encryption.de: We have detected that there is no TLS encryption for this host.
security_center.checks.tls_encryption.ri: Without TLS encryption, traffic between the client and your web server is unencrypted and can be viewed by third parties. TLS encryption is a requirement for PCI compliance.
security_center.checks.tls_encryption.de: Your host accepts HTTP connections on port 80 but does not accept HTTPS connections on port 443. As a result, we have determined that you do not have TLS encryption set up for this host.
security_center.checks.tls_encryption.mi: Set up TLS encryption for your host
Update the SSL/TLS encryption mode to Full (strict) for this zone.
security_center.checks.tls_version.gener: We have detected a domain supporting an older TLS version. You have a higher risk of insecure encryption. |||| We have detected %{smart_count} domains supporting an older TLS version. You have a higher risk of insecure encryption.
security_center.checks.tls_version.issue: Minimum Version of TLS 1.2 not enforced
security_center.checks.tls_version.descr: Your host supports older versions of the TLS protocol.
security_center.checks.tls_version.risk_: Older versions of the TLS protocol are considered insecure. Enforcing a minimum of TLS 1.2 is a requirement for PCI compliance.
security_center.checks.tls_version.detec: We have successfully made HTTPS connections to port 443 specifying TLS 1.0 and TLS 1.1.
security_center.checks.tls_version.mitig: Reconfigure the minimum TLS version for this zone to TLS 1.2 in your Cloudflare SSL/TLS Edge Certificates settings.
security_center.checks.always_https.gene: We have detected a domain without "Always Use HTTPS" enabled. Data transmitted to or from your domain may be visible to others. |||| We have detected %{smart_count} domains without "Always Use HTTPS" enabled. Data transmitted to or from your domain may be visible to others.
security_center.checks.always_https.desc: HTTP requests to your host do not redirect to the equivalent HTTPS request.
security_center.checks.always_https.risk: If users are not redirected to use TLS encryption, traffic between the client and your web server may be unencrypted and can be viewed by third parties.
security_center.checks.always_https.dete: We've made an HTTP request on port 80 and received a response, but the response was not a 301 redirect to the corresponding HTTPS URL.
security_center.checks.always_https.miti: Enable Always Use HTTPS in your zone's Cloudflare SSL/TLS Edge Certificates settings.
security_center.checks.hsts.generic.deta: We have detected a domain not enforcing HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS). Data transmitted to or from your domain may be visible to others. |||| We have detected %{smart_count} domains not enforcing HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS). Data transmitted to or from your domain may be visible to others.
security_center.checks.hsts.issue: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) not enforced
security_center.checks.hsts.description: HTTP Strict Transport Security is a header which allows a website to specify and enforce security policy in client web browsers. This policy enforcement protects secure websites from downgrade attacks, SSL stripping, and cookie hijacking.
security_center.checks.hsts.risk_descrip: If HSTS is not enforced, traffic between the client and your web server may be unencrypted and can be viewed by third parties.
security_center.checks.hsts.detection: We have made HTTP and HTTPS requests to your hostname to check for the presence of the Strict-Transport-Security header in the response. We have not detected the correct header in the response.
security_center.checks.hsts.mitigation_d: Enable HSTS in your zone's Cloudflare SSL/TLS Edge Certificates settings.
security_center.checks.mfa.generic.title: Users without MFA
security_center.checks.mfa.generic.detai: We have detected a user without MFA enabled. You have a higher risk of account takeover. |||| We have detected %{smart_count} users without MFA enabled. You have a higher risk of account takeover.
security_center.checks.mfa.description: We have detected that Cloudflare administrative user %{email} has not enabled multifactor authentication.
security_center.checks.mfa.risk_descript: Multifactor authentication (MFA) provides an additional layer of protection against account takeover. If an attacker gets an administrator's Cloudflare login details and MFA is enabled, the attacker would not be able to log into the account.
security_center.checks.mfa.detection: We have reviewed the authentication settings of the user %{email} and detected that they have not enabled MFA.
security_center.checks.mfa.mitigation: Require two-factor authentication for your account
security_center.checks.mfa.mitigation_de: Require two-factor authentication (2FA) for your Cloudflare account. All members of your Cloudflare account will be required to set up 2FA.

security_center.checks.waf.risk: Insufficient protection against web application attacks
security_center.checks.waf.risk_descript: Your web application may be susceptible to attacks that exploit known, common web application vulnerabilities.
security_center.checks.waf.detection: We have reviewed your WAF settings and detected that either Managed Rules are disabled across your zone or Managed Rules is enabled for your zone but all individual rules are disabled.

security_center.checks.exposed_rdp_serve: We detect an exposed RDP server. This remote desktop is exposed to the public internet. |||| We detect %{smart_count} exposed RDP servers. These remote desktops are exposed to the public internet.
We detect that you may have exposed an RDP server to the public internet.
Internal resources exposed to the public internet.
Anyone may be able to access the remote desktop when an RDP server is exposed to the public internet without any access policies in place.
We have detected that TCP connections on port 3389 for this host succeed.
Set up a Cloudflare Access policy for this host
By setting up a Cloudflare Access policy for this host, you can prevent anyone on the public internet from accessing your RDP server.
Manage in the Zero Trust dash
security_center.checks.tunnels_protected: We detect an unprotected Cloudflare Tunnel. The application served by the Tunnel is exposed to the public internet. |||| We detect %{smart_count} unprotected Cloudflare Tunnels. The applications served by these Tunnels are exposed to the public internet.
We have detected an application that is served by a Cloudflare Tunnel but not protected by a corresponding Access policy.
Internal resources exposed to the public internet
The application served by the Cloudflare Tunnel is accessible to anyone on the public internet.
Based on your Cloudflare settings, we have identified at least one hostname served by the Cloudflare Tunnel that is not protected by a corresponding Cloudflare Access policy.
Create an Access policy to secure who can have access to the application served by the Cloudflare Tunnel.
Manage in the Zero Trust dash
security_center.checks.waf_not_enabled.g: We have detected a zone without Cloudflare Managed Rules enabled. You have a higher risk of web application attacks. |||| We have detected %{smart_count} zones without Cloudflare Managed Rules enabled. You have a higher risk of web application attacks.
security_center.checks.waf_not_enabled.d: We have detected that you have not enabled the Cloudflare Managed Rules feature on your zone.
security_center.checks.waf_not_enabled.r: Insufficient protection for vulnerabilities targeting Web and API applications

Insufficient protection for vulnerabilities targeting Web and API applications. This could lead to successful attacks, such as SQL injection (SQLi) and Cross-Site Scripting (XSS), or not being protected from the latest Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVEs) of software commonly running on applications.
security_center.checks.waf_not_enabled.d: We evaluated your websites and you have no Managed Rules deployed.
security_center.checks.waf_not_enabled.m: Deploy Cloudflare Managed Rules on your zone to protect your web application against common vulnerabilities in web applications.
security_center.checks.access_setup_inco: Your Cloudflare Access setup is incomplete. Get started today!

security_center.checks.access_identity_p: Cloudflare integrates with major identity providers to provide more granular policies and security controls.

security_center.checks.api_endpoints_not: API Discovery has detected new API endpoints in your zone's traffic.
API Discovery has detected new API endpoints in your zone's traffic.
These new endpoints are not managed in API Shield's Endpoint Management.
API Shield can only actively protect managed endpoints.
Visit API Discovery and choose 'save' for API endpoints you wish to protect.
You may safely choose 'ignore' for endpoints that are not part of your API or simply don't need protection.
security_center.checks.security_txt_not_: Configure and manage the Security.txt file to improve the website's vulnerability disclosure process

The absence of Security.txt insights creates a lack of a clear, accessible method for researchers to report vulnerabilities. This can lead to security issues going unnoticed or under-reported, increasing the risk of exploitation.
We evaluated the Security Settings configured for this domain and found that Security.txt is not enabled.

We have detected a domain not enforcing HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS). Data transmitted to or from your domain may be visible to others. |||| We have detected %{smart_count} domains not enforcing HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS). Data transmitted to or from your domain may be visible to others.
HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) not enforced

HTTP Strict Transport Security is a header which allows a website to specify and enforce security policy in client web browsers. This policy enforcement protects secure websites from downgrade attacks, SSL stripping, and cookie hijacking.
If HSTS is not enforced, traffic between the client and your web server may be unencrypted and can be viewed by third parties.
We have made HTTP and HTTPS requests to your hostname to check for the presence of the Strict-Transport-Security header in the response. We have not detected the correct header in the response.
Enable HSTS in your zone's Cloudflare SSL/TLS Edge Certificates settings.

We reviewed your Cloudflare DNS settings and checked whether your hostname accepts connections on either port 80 or 443.
Configure Cloudflare to proxy the DNS record

By setting up Cloudflare as your hostname's reverse proxy, Cloudflare protects origin servers from DDoS attacks by hiding their IP addresses. You can configure Cloudflare to proxy your hostname in your DNS settings.

security_center.app_sec_report.title: Application security reports
security_center.app_sec_report.descripti:
Application security reports provide insights and trends into requests blocked or challenged by the Cloudflare Application Security suite of products across all of your zones. These reports are automatically generated every month.

To dive deeper into the mitigations performed by Cloudflare security products, use the <0>Security Analytics dashboard.

Having issues or have special requests? <1>Tell us what you think.

url-scanner.summary.name: Name
url-scanner.summary.document.description: Components that make up and interact with the web page served by (URL).
url-scanner.summary.document.html: HTML (Hypertext Markup Language) is the standard language for creating and structuring content on the web. It uses tags to define elements such as text, images, and links on web pages.
url-scanner.summary.document.links: Links (hyperlinks) within a document connect it to other documents or resources, enabling navigation and resource sharing.
url-scanner.summary.document.scripts: Scripts, typically JavaScript, add interactivity and dynamic behavior to the web document, including form validations, animations, and loading new content without refreshing the page.
url-scanner.summary.document.stylesheets: Stylesheets (CSS) are used to define the look and presentation of the web document. This includes layout, colors, fonts, and more, contributing to the visual aspect of the document.
url-scanner.summary.document.cookies: Cookies are small pieces of data stored on the client side, which web documents use to remember stateful information (like user preferences) across page visits and browser sessions.
url-scanner.summary.document.javascript_: JavaScript variables within a document can hold and manipulate data that affect the content and behavior of the web page dynamically.
url-scanner.summary.document.console_log: Console log messages are used by developers to debug and track the behavior of scripts within the document. They provide insights into the execution flow, errors, and other relevant information.
url-scanner.summary.security.safe.descri: No immediate security risks are detected at this URL.
url-scanner.summary.security.not_safe.de: The following security risks are detected at this URL: %{risks}.
url-scanner.summary.security.not_safe.no: This url is considered not safe.
url-scanner.summary.technologies.descrip: Technologies found on the scanned URL, using open source definitions provided by <0>Wappalyzer</0>
url-scanner.summary.technologies.empty: No technologies were found on the scanned URL
url-scanner.summary.summary: This website contacted %{ipCount} in %{countryCount} across %{domainCount} to perform %{transactions}. The main IP is <1>%{ip}, located in %{location} and belongs to %{belongsTo}. The main domain is <3>%{domain}.
url-scanner.network.http_table.title: HTTP transactions: %{number} detected
url-scanner.network.http_table.descripti: All <0>HTTP</0> requests and responses made by the resource during the current session.
url-scanner.network.dns_table.title: DNS records: %{number} found
url-scanner.network.dns_table.descriptio: <0>DNS records</0> provide information about a domain including its associated IP address and how to handle requests for the domain.
url-scanner.network.dns_table.name: Name
url-scanner.behavior.cookies_table.title: Cookies: %{number} found
url-scanner.behavior.cookies_table.descr: <0>HTTP cookies</0> are small text files stored on a user's device, often used to remember user preferences and personalize experiences.
url-scanner.behavior.cookies_table.name: Name
url-scanner.behavior.js_table.title: JavaScript variables: %{number} found
url-scanner.behavior.js_table.descriptio: JavaScript variables that are defined outside of any function and attached to the window object. These global variables are accessible from any part of the code within the same web page, allowing different scripts and functions to share data.
url-scanner.behavior.js_table.name: Name
Console log messages are outputs developers use to display information or debug code within the browser's console.
url-scanner.behavior.html.title: HTML
url-scanner.behavior.html.description: The DOM (Document Object Model) is a programming interface for web documents, representing the page structure as a tree of objects that can be manipulated with JavaScript.
url-scanner.behavior.html.empty: Raw HTML body could not be retrieved
url-scanner.behavior.links.title: Links: %{number} found
url-scanner.behavior.links.description: The outgoing links identified on the web page.
url-scanner.security.description: Security practices used by this site, or security risks associated with it.
url-scanner.security.risks.title: Risks: %{number} found
url-scanner.security.risks.description: Practices detected on this website that may pose security risks.
url-scanner.indicators.title: Indicators
url-scanner.indicators.description: Indicators refer to ASNs, domains, hashes, IPs or URLs that may suggest potential security threats. You can click through each to investigate further details.
<0>SSL/TLS certificates</0> verify server identity and encrypt transactions between the client and server.
url-scanner.security.csp.title: Content security policy: %{number} found
url-scanner.security.csp.description: CSP (content security policy) headers help mitigate some attacks like cross-site scripting (XSS) and data injection
url-scanner.security.tooltip.risks: Practices detected on this website that may pose security risks.
url-scanner.security.tooltip.security_he: HTTP response headers that can harden the security of a web application.
url-scanner.security.tooltip.security_vi: Requests or resources offending Content Security Policies (CSPs) or Subresource Integrity (SRI).
url-scanner.security.tooltip.http_transa: All HTTP requests and responses made by the resource during the current session.
url-scanner.security.tooltip.dns_records: DNS records provide information about a domain including its associated IP address and how to handle requests for the domain.
url-scanner.security.tooltip.certificate: SSL/TLS certificates verify server identity and encrypt transactions between the client and server.
url-scanner.security.headers.title: Security headers: %{number} found
url-scanner.security.headers.description: <0>HTTP response headers</0> that can harden the security of a web application.
url-scanner.security.headers.name: Name
url-scanner.security.headers.tooltip.cac: Control caching in browsers and shared caches
url-scanner.security.headers.tooltip.cle: Control the data stored by a client browser for their origins.
url-scanner.security.headers.tooltip.con: Control resources the user agent is allowed to load for a given page.
url-scanner.security.headers.tooltip.cro: Configure embedding cross-origin resources into the document.
Ensure a top-level document does not share a browsing context group with cross-origin documents.
Request that the browser blocks no-cors cross-origin/cross-site requests to the given resource.
url-scanner.security.headers.tooltip.exp: Deprecated. Opt in to reporting and/or enforcement of Certificate Transparency requirements.
url-scanner.security.headers.tooltip.fea: Deprecated. Replaced by the Permissions-Policy header.
url-scanner.security.headers.tooltip.per: Allow and deny the use of browser features in a document or iframe.
url-scanner.security.headers.tooltip.pub: Deprecated. Allows HTTPS websites to resist impersonation by attackers using mis-issued or otherwise fraudulent certificates.
url-scanner.security.headers.tooltip.ref: Control how much referrer information should be included with requests.
url-scanner.security.headers.tooltip.str: Declare that a website is only accessible over a secure connection (HTTPS).
url-scanner.security.headers.tooltip.x-c: Indicate that the MIME types advertised in the Content-Type headers should be followed and not be changed.
url-scanner.security.headers.tooltip.x-f: Indicate whether a browser should be allowed to render a page in a frame, iframe, embed or object.
url-scanner.security.headers.tooltip.x-p: Control whether a web client such as Adobe Flash Player or Adobe Acrobat has permission to handle data across domains.
url-scanner.security.headers.tooltip.x-x: Deprecated. Stops pages from loading when they detect reflected cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.
url-scanner.security.violations.title: Security violations: %{number} found
url-scanner.security.violations.descript: Requests or resources offending Content Security Policies (CSPs) or Subresource Integrity (SRI).
Control resources the user agent is allowed to load for a given page.
Block unencrypted content from loading in an encrypted page.
Enables browsers to verify that resources fetched are not manipulated.
